The selvedge is ring-spun and woven on old looms set up to reproduce the original slow speed in a special weaving style called 'Crunch'.
This gives the denim a more open weave and so feels softer to wear.
But it is still as tough as old boots in terms of durability.

It is dyed at Sakamoto in pure indigo at low speed in order to achieve a very dark shade. It's then sanforized to keep shrinkage to a minimum.

6648018862150,6648018862150,The Artist Series - Antti Kalevi - The Eira,UK12-30 / 30,the-artist-series-antti-kalevi-the-eira-straight-leg,"

The Fit:
A flattering relaxed high waist jean. A straight leg that has been designed to sit on the ankle.
Designed to sit comfortably at ankle length, it can easily be rolled up into a crop for those that want it.
The Eira is a similar fit to our popular Peggy jean.
With a high waist designed to minimise gaping and a back yoke that falls loose over the bottom for a flattering fit.
An all-rounder, The Eira can be dressed up or down at any time of the year.
Our advice: They fit true to size.

A 100% GOTS organic cotton, microplastic-free denim with a soft hand feel which gives it a beautiful drape. 

A medium-dark indigo dyed with Kitotex, a natural polymer from mushrooms and seaweed from the greenest denim mill in the world - Candiani Denim.
Limited Edition Hiut Denim branded leather patch.
For best results, go 6 months without washing. Wash on 30˚C. Do not tumble dry. Free repairs for life. As always, made in Wales.

Thank you for your support. Your belief in quality makes this all work.

Please note the model is wearing a 26W.

Made from 100% GOTS organic cotton and dyed using recycled cotton plant residue from the Candiani denim mill. This fabric contains no microplastic or sulphites.
Limited Edition Hiut Denim branded leather patch.
Limited edition lilac owl rivet on left back pocket.

7063345954886,7063345954886,The Bespoke Service,"Wednesday, September 6th",the-bespoke-service,"

The Factory Fitting Service
The idea is you come to the factory and we work with you to help you find your perfect fit.
First, you try on all our fits and see which block suits you best.
You then talk to Claudio and the cutting team to see what tweaks need to be made to the pattern to make it the perfect fit for you.
Although we can’t redesign a jean, we can make small changes that can make a massive difference to your fit.
For example, we can alter things like the rise, the leg opening, the pocket and the leg length.
We can discuss whether to ‘cuff’ or ‘not cuff’. And, more importantly, what size the cuff should be.
We can talk you through fabric options and show you some of the rarer and end-of-roll fabrics we keep in the factory.
You can meet with our designer to create a graphic for your very own leather or vegan back patch.
You can meet the team and we will show you around the factory.

And of course, there will be coffee and cake.

7004248539206,7004248539206,Do One Thing Well Poster - Black,Default Title,do-one-thing-well-poster-black,"<meta charset=""utf-8"">
We have one mantra: Do One Thing Well.
That idea is the life-blood of the business.
We make jeans. Some of the best in the world.
We have one mantra and many passions.
Because you can't beat the power of print.
This matte black print will make the perfect addition to any living or work space.
The Déjà Blue programme is currently closed until later in the year.
Sign up to our newsletter to be the first to know when we reopen.
We’re closing the loop. Our jeans are made to last.
The Déjà Blue programme means there is now a way to return them to us.
And we will give you a £50 voucher off a new pair.
Then. One day, they end up on the shelf.
No big fall out. Just a subtle drift apart.
They might not fit. Too small. Too big.
Simply add the Deja Blue to your cart. Checkout for free, and send us your Hiut jeans back.
Once we’ve received the Hiut jeans, we’ll email you your credit.

*Please note: One £50 voucher per transaction. Voucher is valid for 6 months after issue date.

column1: The theme this year will be ' This works.'
We want you to leave Makers+ Mavericks with new skills, new insights, new capabilities.
We have no doubt the economy will be tough in 2023, but some people will thrive in any economy.
1. How to grow your business on LinkedIn?
2. What is the unlikely magic of a founder brand?
3. Why a landing page is more important than your website?
4. How to find your voice even if you are an introvert?
6. Write your way to growth without going to overwhelm?
If you are a founder, company of one, leader of an agency, freelancer, this will prove to be an important day for you. There will be gold here for you.
This M+M will have more focus on workshops, so you will leave knowing the secret sauce on how to do something that will grow your business, even in a tough economy. Super practical.
Plus a dinner with your fellow founders etc.
Cardigan. West Wales. On our Farm. Where we hold The DO Lectures.

April 29th 2023. It's a Saturday. You could make a weekend of it. The weather here will still be beautiful (touch wood) but there will be fewer people around, so you will have the beaches to yourselves to explore.
We are all part of an incredible creative community. That itself is something to celebrate.
I think we all appreciate that just a little bit more now. This is a rare time when we can all:
That sounds like a pretty good reason to us.
If you are still around on the Sunday, we will give you a tour of the factory. (We will put on a little something for breakfast, too.)
This covers all food including lunch and an evening supper. As part of the day, there will be talks and workshops.
There is no accommodation included. But, you are welcome to camp in our fields. There are great showers etc.
We can also help you find great local accommodation.
The sea is still cold. But should be warmer by April.
When we announce the speaker list if it’s not for you, no sweat. You will be given 48 hours to let us know and we will give you a full refund.
• Ankle length (30"" inside leg will finish at 28"")
